headline: Why Old Dominion Freight Line (ODFL) Stock Is Falling Today
summary: Shares of freight carrier Old Dominion (NASDAQ:ODFL) fell 8.7% in the afternoon session after the company reported second-quarter earnings and revenue that missed Wall Street expectations.

headline: Old Dominion falls, Teradyne soars, Palo Alto Networks & CyberArk
summary: Here are some of the stories Wall Street is watching on Wednesday, July 30. Shares of Old Dominion Freight Line (ODFL) are falling after posting second quarter results that fell short of estimates. Teradyne (TER) shares are skyrocketing on a big Q2 beat. Palo Alto Networks (PANW) is falling after announcing its buying CyberArk (CYBR) in a $25 billion deal. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Old Dominion not changing course as downturn lingers

headline: Why Saia (SAIA) Stock Is Down Today
summary: Shares of freight transportation and logistics provider Saia (NASDAQ:SAIA) fell 3% in the morning session after its peer, Old Dominion Freight Line, reported disappointing second-quarter results that fueled sector-wide concerns. Old Dominion, a major trucking company, posted second-quarter earnings and revenue that both fell short of Wall Street's expectations. headline: Old Dominion Freight Line CEO Remains Confident In Long-Term Growth Despite Downturn
summary: Old Dominion Freight Line, Inc. (NASDAQ:ODFL) shares plunged Wednesday after it reported weaker-than-expected second-quarter earnings. Economic softness weighed on freight volumes and revenue. The company posted earnings of $1.27 per share, down 14.2% from $1.48 in the year-ago period and below the Street estimate of $1.30. Revenue fell 6.1% to $1.41 billion, missing expectations of $1.43 billion. Net income for the quarter declined to $268.6 million, compared with $322 million in the second qua

headline: Old Dominion Freight Line (NASDAQ:ODFL) Misses Q2 Revenue Estimates, Stock Drops
summary: Freight carrier Old Dominion (NASDAQ:ODFL) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales falling 6.1% year on year to $1.41 billion. Its GAAP profit of $1.27 per share was 1.1% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Old Dominion: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: THOMASVILLE, N.C. (AP) — Old Dominion Freight Line Inc. ODFL) on Wednesday reported second-quarter net income of $268.6 million. On a per-share basis, the Thomasville, North Carolina-based company said it had net income of $1.27.
